saitMLS.problemDomain.clientale

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • saitMLS.problemDomain.clientale.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    A Client object containing information about a Client and its activity. Exceptions include InvalidPhoneNumberException and InvalidPostalCodeException.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    729380

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SIZE
      The size of each client object in the random access file.

    • Field Detail

      • SIZE

        public static int SIZE
        The size of each client object in the random access file. Currently 105 bytes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        The default Client constructor. Creates an empty Client object that is inactive.

      • Client

        public Client(long id,
              java.lang.String firstName,
              java.lang.String lastName,
              java.lang.String address,
              java.lang.String postalCode,
              java.lang.String phoneNumber,
              char clientType)
       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,
              InvalidPostalCodeException
        Creates a Client object. The postalCode and phoneNumber must be verified. clientType is C or R. All objects created by this are active by default.
        Parameters:
        id - the Client ID as a long.
        firstName - the Client's first name.
        lastName - the Client's last name or surname.
        address - the Client's address.
        postalCode - the Client's postal code.
        phoneNumber - the Client's phone number.
        clientType - the Client's client type. C for commercial, R for residential.
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - in case the phone number does not meet this format: ###-###-####.
        InvalidPostalCodeException - in case the postal code does not meet this format: A1A 1A1.

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String line)
       throws InvalidPostalCodeException,
              InvalidPhoneNumberException
        A constructor that uses a single line to construct a Client object.
        Parameters:
        line - A single line containing all client information separated by ; Order is ID, firstname, lastname, address, postalcode, phonenumber, clienttype
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - in case the phone number does not meet this format: ###-###-####.
        InvalidPostalCodeException - in case the postal code does not meet this format: A1A 1A1.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks if the client is active or not.
        Returns:
        true if active == true, false if active == false

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean active)
        Sets active as true or false.
        Parameters:
        active - the state to set active to.

        Parameters:

      • getClientType

        public char getClientType()
        A simple get method to return the client's type. C for commercial, R for residential.
        Returns:
        A char of the client's type. C for commercial, R for residential.

      • setClientType

        public void setClientType(char clientType)
        A simple method to set that client's type. C for commercial, R for residential.
        Parameters:
        clientType - the client's type. C for commercial, R for residential.

      • getFirstName

        A simple method to get the client's first name.
        Returns:
        the client's first name.

      • setFirstName

        public void setFirstName(java.lang.String firstName)
        A simple method to set the client's first name.
        Parameters:
        firstName - the client's updated first name.

      • getId

        public long getId()
        A simple method to get the client's ID.
        Returns:
        the client's ID.

      • setId

        public void setId(long id)
        A simple method to set the client's ID. Note that changing the client's ID and using the persist method in ClientBroker may cause it to overwrite another client.
        Parameters:
        id - the client's new ID.

      • getPhoneNumber

        public java.lang.String getPhoneNumber()
        A simple method to get the client's phone number in this format ###-###-####.
        Returns:
        The client's phone number in this format ###-###-####.

      • setPhoneNumber

        public void setPhoneNumber(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
                    throws InvalidPhoneNumberException
        A simple method to set the client's phone number in this format ###-###-####.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - The client's updated phone number in this format ###-###-####.
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - In the case that the phone number does not match this format: ###-###-####.

      • getPostalCode

        public java.lang.String getPostalCode()
        A simple method to get the client's postal code.
        Returns:
        The client's postal code.

      • setPostalCode

        public void setPostalCode(java.lang.String postalCode)
                   throws InvalidPostalCodeException
        A simple method to set the client's postal code in this format: A1A 1A1.
        Parameters:
        postalCode - The client's updated postal code in this format: A1A 1A1.
        Throws:
        InvalidPostalCodeException - In case the postal code does not match this format: A1A 1A1.

      • getSIZE

        public static int getSIZE()
        A simple method to get the Client class object size based on the ClientBroker class. I'm not sure why the javadoc wanted this class to contain the size considering the Broker writes it.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the number of bytes in a Client object written to a RAF file using the ClientBroker class.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        An equals override method that checks if an object equals this one. Checks specifically for a matching ID.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - An object that is supposed to be a Client object to be tested for equality.
        Returns:
        True if the ID's match and false if they do not or if obj is not an instance of Client.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A toString override that outputs all Client information.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A client containing the information of this client neatly presented in a line.
